metadata.synopsis: Origin moment for Minsc with Roah.After Minsc learns of the Zhentarim plans to overthrow Nine-Fingers, he returns to the Guildhall to confront their leader, Roah. She taunts him with his past evil deeds as the 'Stone Lord' - the player decideds whether to back Minsc and fight Roah, or let Roah's plan come to fruition for the 'greater good'.ATTN: This double origin moment was degraded to a single origin moment with only Minsc
metadata.how_to_trigger: CTY_Main_ARecruit MinscDebug book (ctrl shift 9)- Set quest flags & options- Act 3 (LOW)- LOW - Guildhall- Guildhall State DuringCoup

10.speaker: Roah Moonglow
10.text: So it's that simple! Drop your weapons, bring out Nine-Fingers, and this can all end peacefully! For you, at least.
10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Party enters the Guildhall to find Roah standing at the railing, addressing the crwod. Her Zhentarim stand arrayed for battle, with the Guild standing defensively against them. She finishes her line, and turns to greet us.

51.speaker: Roah Moonglow
51.text: What's this, Stone Lord? It's a little late to change the terms of our deal - the pieces are already in place.

64.speaker: Minsc
64.text: The Stone Lord is no more. Boo and Jaheira and my friend would not let me stay cursed.

17.speaker: Minsc
17.text: And the only terms we offer are between my boot and your treacherous buttocks.

42.speaker: Roah Moonglow
42.text: I see. That's unfortunate. And what about the adult in the room?

60.speaker: Roah Moonglow
60.text: Whatever I told that lot below, this will end in bloodshed. All you have to do is pick the right side.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: What are you doing? Why turn on the Guild?

57.speaker: Roah Moonglow
57.text: I'm not. I'm turning on Nine-Fingers - this place has been due a change in management for some time.

19.speaker: Roah Moonglow
19.text: The Zhentarim have been trying to crack Baldur's Gate for years, but Nine-Fingers' grip has been too strong. And look what it's come to.

20.speaker: Roah Moonglow
20.text: Her Guild is disorganised. Undisciplined. The cult broke them in a matter of days, while my Zhentarim still stand strong.

62.speaker: Roah Moonglow
62.text: A Guild under our control can do what Nine-Fingers failed to - drive the Absolute out of the city, once and for all.

36.speaker: Roah Moonglow
36.text: And then remain on in the city, to protect its good citizens from any future threats. For a reasonable fee, of course.

63.speaker: Minsc
63.text: My hamster can smell your lies, villain. Foul not his little nose.
63.context: NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

26.speaker: Roah Moonglow
26.text: Fine. Let us talk of truth, then. Do your friends know how many you killed in the Absolute's name, Stone Lord? Do you?

50.speaker: Minsc
50.text: I... do not call me that. Minsc is Minsc!
50.context: NodeContext: Thrown, but insistent - he does not want to remember the things he did.

14.speaker: Roah Moonglow
14.text: Oh? I don't recall any tales of Minsc helping the likes of Nine-Fingers - a known thief, a murderer. I thought Minsc of Rashemen served the side of good?

47.speaker: Minsc
47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bowing his head, dejectedNodeContext: For once, has no response

5.speaker: Roah Moonglow
5.text: I'm the last to judge, big man. You were just following orders. And hey - that's all you have to do now.

22.speaker: Roah Moonglow
22.text: If you don't know what's right, just let the grown-ups talk. Because I know your friend will make the smart choice.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: You're mistaken. Minsc of Rashemen always knows the right thing to do.

40.speaker: Minsc
40.text: Your leader is not wrong. The Guild is a band of treacherous scoundrels, and Nine-Fingers the worst among them!
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc looking up, dejection to hope. He nods and steps forward to stand beside Roah, facing the gathered Zhentarim below.

58.speaker: Minsc
58.text: But the Stone Lord... Minsc... was many times worse. I have no right to judge.

3.speaker: Minsc
3.text: So it will not be Minsc who does the judging.
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standard animation as he reaches into inventory out of frame - and comes back with Boo in his hand, held over the crowd.NodeContext: Include gesture of getting Boo from magic pocket and holding in front of him, Boo sat in Minsc's Palm.

45.speaker: Minsc
45.text: MY HAMSTER WILL COUNT TO THREE! LAY DOWN YOUR ARMS, ZHENTARIM, AND BOO WILL SPARE YOUR LIVES!

43.speaker: Roah Moonglow
43.text: Truly? I am handing you the Guild, and you'd throw it all away on the word of a madman?

21.speaker: Roah Moonglow
21.text: Think about this. It defies all logic, I -

30.speaker: Player
30.text: We stand with the Guild. So get out of the way.

53.speaker: Roah Moonglow
53.text: You're making a big mistake. And for what? There's no sense in this - no profit. Nobody goes against the Zhent and lives.

35.speaker: Minsc
35.text: Enough of your filth. Cover your ears Boo. The cracking of the necks of evil will be louder than the mating cries of a snow tiger.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Fine. Give your Zhentarim the order - we take this place, and split the spoils.

16.speaker: Minsc
16.text: Why would you side with this villain? Boo does not... I do not understand.

18.speaker: Roah Moonglow
18.text: Cheer up, Minsc - this is about the greater good. Maybe your hamster will explain it to you one day.
18.context: CinematicNodeContext: She cups a hand beside her ear in the direction of Nine-Fingers' office.

59.speaker: Roah Moonglow
59.text: Enough negotiations, Zhentarim! It's time to take our due!
59.context: NodeContext: Turning to shout at her people gathered below.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: I will. But I don't think you'll like my choice.

56.speaker: Roah Moonglow
56.text: Hah, a hero. There's a time for heroics, my friend, and a time for common sense. This is the latter.

23.speaker: Roah Moonglow
23.text: So it's that simple! Drop your weapons, bring out Nine-Fingers, and this can all end peacefully! For you, at least.
23.context: CinematicNodeContext: Party enters the Guildhall to find Roah standing at the railing, addressing the crwod. Her Zhentarim stand arrayed for battle, with the Guild standing defensively against them. She finishes her line, and turns to greet us.

48.speaker: Roah Moonglow
48.text: What's this, Stone Lord? It's a little late to change the terms of our deal - the pieces are already in place.

28.speaker: Minsc
28.text: The Stone Lord is no more. Boo and Jaheira and my friend would not let me stay cursed.

1.speaker: Minsc
1.text: And the only terms we offer are between my boot and your treacherous buttocks.

38.speaker: Roah Moonglow
38.text: Unfortunate. But if you'll only listen a moment, you'll see we want the same thing.

7.speaker: Minsc
7.text: Oh? Minsc is wanting is to close your mouth with a kick. And you?

29.speaker: Roah Moonglow
29.text: Justice. Nine-Fingers, punished for what she did to you. And the Zhentarim, rewarded for their stead-fastedness.

41.speaker: Roah Moonglow
41.text: The Zhentarim have been trying to crack Baldur's Gate for years, but Nine-Fingers' grip has been too strong. And look what it's come to.

33.speaker: Roah Moonglow
33.text: A Guild under our control can do what Nine-Fingers failed to - drive the Absolute out of the city, once and for all.

27.speaker: Roah Moonglow
27.text: And then remain on in the city, to protect its good citizens from any future threats. For a reasonable fee, of course.

32.speaker: Minsc
32.text: My hamster can smell your lies, villain. Foul not his little nose.
32.context: NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

46.speaker: Roah Moonglow
46.text: Fine. Let us talk of truth, then. Do your friends know how many you killed in the Absolute's name, Stone Lord? Do you?

54.speaker: Minsc
54.text: I... do not call me that. Minsc is Minsc!
54.context: NodeContext: Thrown, but insistent - he does not want to remember the things he did.

6.speaker: Roah Moonglow
6.text: Oh? I don't recall any tales of Minsc helping the likes of Nine-Fingers - a known thief, a murderer. I thought Minsc of Rashemen served the side of good?

61.speaker: Minsc
61.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bowing his head, dejectedNodeContext: For once, has no response

55.speaker: Roah Moonglow
55.text: No judgement. It's hard to know the right thing. Better to let others do the thinking, eh?

2.speaker: Minsc
2.context: NodeContext: Raising his head, no longer despondent.

49.speaker: Minsc
49.text: Your leader is not wrong. The Guild is a band of treacherous scoundrels, and Nine-Fingers the worst among them!
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc looking up, dejection to hope. He nods and steps forward to stand beside Roah, facing the gathered Zhentarim below.

9.speaker: Minsc
9.text: But the Stone Lord... Minsc... was many times worse. I have no right to judge.

39.speaker: Minsc
39.text: So it will not be Minsc who does the judging.
39.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standard animation as he reaches into inventory out of frame - and comes back with Boo in his hand, held over the crowd.NodeContext: Include gesture of getting Boo from magic pocket and holding in front of him, Boo sat in Minsc's Palm.

24.speaker: Minsc
24.text: MY HAMSTER WILL COUNT TO THREE! LAY DOWN YOUR ARMS, ZHENTARIM, AND BOO WILL SPARE YOUR LIVES!

12.speaker: Roah Moonglow
12.text: Think about this. It defies all logic, I -
